lines.content: * The main class for the chatbot application.
* This class initializes the chatbot, handles user input, and starts the lobby.
* The entry point of the chatbot application.
// Create a Scanner object to handle user input
// Initialize the lobby where users can choose modes
* Starts the chatbot lobby where users can select different modes.
* Close the scanner to free up resources.
* Represents Eggo lobby where users can interact with and switch between different modes.
* The lobby serves as the main entry point and management interface for available eggo modes.
private final Map<String, Mode> modes; // Stores available eggo modes
* Initializes the eggo lobby with different modes.
modes.put("echo", new EchoMode()); // Register Echo Mode
modes.put("task", new TaskMode()); // Register Task Mode
* - Predefined responses for common input cases.
private static final Map<String, String> responseMap = new HashMap<>();
responseMap.put("hello", "Hi! How can I assist you today?");
responseMap.put("what's your name?", "My name is Eggo! How can I assist you today?");

* @param scanner Scanner object to read user input.

* - Print standard messages with consistent formatting.
* - Display informational, warning, and error messages.
* - Apply indentation and separators to outputs for better readability.
* Call static methods like {@code OutputHandler.printInfo("Message")} to display messages.
| |___  | (_| | | (_| | | (_) |  <-- Yep this is also an egg
What can I do for you?""";
OutputHandler.print("I didn't catch that. Could you try again?");
* Message displayed when the user enters Echo Mode.
You have entered Echo Mode! Type something, and I'll repeat it.
Press 'Ctrl + Q' (Currently Unavailable, type 'exit' or 'bye' instead) to return to the lobby.""";
* Starts Echo Mode and repeats user input until the user exits.
* Represents a mode in the chatbot system.
* Each mode provides a unique functionality and follows a standard structure.
* Implementing classes should define the behavior of `start(Scanner scanner)`,
* which is responsible for handling user interactions within that mode.
* Starts the mode and manages user interactions.
* Implementing classes should handle user input and define mode-specific behaviors.
* @param scanner Scanner object to read user input.
// void stop(Scanner scanner); // Optional: Define behavior for stopping a mode.
* - Allows the user to add tasks, list them, rename and delete.
* - Allows the tasks to be marked as done, urgent or important.
* - The list will be saved upon updates and automatically load upon entry.
Type 'event [description] /from [start time] /to [end time]' to add an event.
Type 'mark [indices]' to mark tasks as done.
Type 'unmark [indices]' to mark tasks as not done.
Type 'rename [index] [new task name]' to rename a task).
Type 'urg [indices]' to mark tasks as urgent.
Type 'imp [indices]' to mark tasks as important.
Type 'help' to view the help menu.
Type 'exit' to return to the Lobby.""";

* Manages the storage and retrieval of tasks from a file.

* Saves the current task list to a file.
* The tasks are stored in a structured format where each task type (Todo, Deadline, Event)
* is represented by a specific identifier, followed by task properties such as completion
* status, urgency, importance, and additional task-specific details.
* If the storage directory does not exist, it will attempt to create it.
* In case of any errors, they will be logged but will not interrupt the program execution.
throw new DirectoryCreationException("Failed to create directory: " + directory.getAbsolutePath());

throw new CorruptedTaskEntryException("Malformed event entry: " + line);
